column51: Notes

column53: Average Peak CCU by Pricing Type
column59: Compares average concurrent player activity between Free-to-Play and Paid games to evaluate the relationship between pricing model and popularity.

column51: Overall user sentiment adjusted for review volume to reduce low-sample bias.
Indicates the typical level of user engagement and feedback per title.
Measures long-term engagement among games with available playtime data.

column53: Average User Sentiment by Pricing Type
column59: Compares average user sentiment metrics across pricing models to assess differences in user satisfaction.

column51: Represents the total scale of user feedback across the platform.
Reflects the average concurrent player activity and short-term popularity.
Represents the average long-term ownership scale of games on the platform.
column59: Summarizes total review volume and game counts across popularity tiers to examine the distribution of user engagement.

column44: Empty  columns for future additions if need be

column51: Shows the proportion of games achieving exceptionally high player activity.
Represents games with strong but not extreme popularity levels.
Captures moderately popular titles with stable but limited reach.
Indicates the dominance of low-visibility games in the overall catalog.

column51: Share of total reviews generated by a very small number of top-performing games.

column59: Compares average platform support across popularity tiers to examine whether broader operating system availability is associated with higher popularity.

column51: Engagement contribution from moderately popular games.

Proportion of the catalog offered at zero price.
Proportion of games requiring upfront purchase.

column51: Indicates how many games support more than one operating system.

Proxy metric combining discount levels with player activity to explore pricing effects.
Represents the typical upfront price point for paid games on the platform.
